title: Ticket #2877: add -_condor_relocatable argument for submitting a standalone ckpt
description:
We need to be able to submit a standalone checkpoint image as a standard universe job. The only thing preventing this from working is the chdir() call that happens when restarting.

Years ago Pete implemented a -_condor_relocatable argument that, if defined, would skip the chdir(), but it never made it into a release (only because we dropped the ball).

It's now becoming very important again, as it would allow us to take advantage of a huge (3k-10k core) opportunistic Condor pool on campus.

If for some reason this isn't trivial (i.e., it's more complicated than adding an "if arg_condor_relocatable == False" before the chdir) then it can be bumped to a Priority 2 -- but if it's not a complicated fix it's a very high priority for us. Thanks!
